SEARCH
Package Domain

Class MediaItem

java.lang.Object
Domain.MediaItem
Direct Known Subclasses:
Book, CD
public abstract class MediaItem extends Object
Represents a generic media item in the library system. This abstract class provides common fields and behaviors shared by different media types such as books and CDs.

Subclasses must define borrowing period and fine amounts.

Example usage:


 MediaItem item = new Book("Title", "Author", "ISBN123");
 System.out.println(item.getTitle());
Since:
1.0

  • Constructor Details

    • MediaItem

      protected MediaItem(String title, String author)
      Creates a new media item with the specified title and author. Items are marked available by default.
      Parameters:
      title - the title of the media item
      author - the author or creator of the media item

  • Method Details

    • getBorrowingPeriodDays

      public abstract int getBorrowingPeriodDays()
      Returns the number of days this item may be borrowed. Must be implemented by subclasses.
      Returns:
      the borrowing period in days

    • getFinePerDay

      public abstract int getFinePerDay()
      Returns the fine charged per overdue day for this item. Must be implemented by subclasses.
      Returns:
      the fine per day

      public boolean isAvailable()
      Returns whether this item is currently available for borrowing.
      Returns:
      true if available, otherwise false

    • setAvailable

      public void setAvailable(boolean available)
      Sets whether the item is available for borrowing.
      Parameters:
      available - true if available, false if borrowed

    • getIsbnOrId

      public String getIsbnOrId()
      Returns an identifier for this media item. For books and CDs, this returns their ISBN. For unknown types, it returns a generated ID.
      Returns:
      the ISBN or fallback identifier

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a generic string representation of the media item.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a formatted string including class name, title, author, and availability
